summary: Harriet Tubman lived most of her life working to free her people. She ran away to the north as a young slave and frequently returned to the south to help other slaves escape. She became a famous leader of the underground railroad, a secret network of households providing food and shelter to runaway slaves. Harriet led groups of slaves from one point to another on a perilous journey north, hiding during the day and traveling at night. Her daring rescues helped hundreds of slaves escape to freedom.
quotes: a secret network of households that provide food and shelter to runaway slaves
